message: this is a simple web app that takes paragraphs and converts it into multipart tweets for twitter, it uses native DOM apis and HandleBars.js for templates and Pure CSS framework by Yahoo, only tested it on firefox and chrome
story: Mahmoud Mustafa El-Badry shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: mahmoudelbadry/cutter
caption: github.com
description: cutter - a webapp that cuts your paragraphs into multipart tweets

data.message:
Add this to your index.html to fix the HTML5 issues on IE9:

<!-- HTML5 shim and Respond.js IE8 support of HTML5 elements and media queries -->
<!--[if lt IE 9]>
  <script src="https://oss.maxcdn.com/libs/html5shiv/3.7.0/html5shiv.js"></script>
  <script src="https://oss.maxcdn.com/libs/respond.js/1.4.2/respond.min.js"></script>
<![endif]-->

And for the placeholder issue: http://corymathews.com/html5-placeholder-in-ie/

ElBaradei will like this one :P
nice one, I have two suggestions:
- besides the per-tweet button, add one button to tweet all the cut tweets
- add back button at top as well

the problem is I don't know if it's possible to post a tweet to twitter from javascript (same origin policy) , I'll look into it and as for the back button and the placeholder i'll try to add them soon
